location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'QATAR. Red Spur covered with mica 300-400 yds North of JABAL NAKHSH - & parallel with it.'

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions: 67 x 110 mm.Foliation: the main folio number, 136, appears on a separate insert in the top right corner of the polyester sleeve in which the photograph is housed. An additional folio number, which is not circled, appears in the same position.

mods.abstract: Photograph of mica hill near Jabal Nakhsh (300-400 yards ['yds'] north of Jabal Nakhsh) in Qatar. The title is inscribed on the verso of the item, together with a further description, which states where and when the photograph was taken, and gives additional topographical information.The photograph was sent by Ernest Vincent Packer, Manager, Petroleum Concessions Limited, Bahrain to Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch, Political Resident, Bahrain. Packer's covering letter, dated 17 March 1937, is on folio 133 of IOR/R/15/2/160. Packer adds in the letter: 'the mica hill is easily seen from some 5 miles away when approaching Jabal Naksh by car from the North or North-East and rather masks Jabal Nakhsh'.
